titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that individuals who have attained age 59 1/2 may contribute to individual retirement accounts without regard to their compensation.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 5/16/1995--Introduced. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow individuals who have attained age 59 and one-half to deduct amounts contributed to individual retirement accounts without regard to their compensation.
